snippet: The new regulation intended to curb recklessness in the financial system is an achievement in word, but not yet in deed.
abstract: Editorial praises final version of the Volcker Rule for being much stronger than earlier drafts; contends success of the rule, which bars banks from trading for their own gain, will depend on how well federal regulators enforce it.
lead_paragraph: The new regulation intended to curb recklessness in the financial system is an achievement in word, but not yet in deed.

keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
